The correct order of events is: (1) The slide titled "AGILE: NEW SOFTWARE TEAMS" appears on screen. (2) The speaker mentions a "ten million dollar prize purse" for the Automotive X Prize. (3) A loud door-slamming sound occurs at the end of the anecdote about attending composite school. (4) After saying "Agile, Lean, and Scrum," a distinct beep is heard. (5) The screen shows "BUILT IN 3 MONTHS" next to the orange car team. (6) Laughter and applause erupt after the claim of building a carbon fiber body in three days for $800. (7) The overlay "XP: PAIRING AND SWARMING" is shown while two people work on an engine. Therefore, the correct answer is C: 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4 -> 6 -> 5 -> 7.

Answer: C

The correct order of the moments is: (1) A diagram labeled "MODULARITY" with component callouts is shown. (2) The text "Lean: USE LESS STUFF" appears in a workshop scene. (3) The speaker says it's called "Scrum," the smallest, fastest way to organize a team. (4) The on-screen text "XP: PAIRING AND SWARMING" appears as two people work on an engine. (5) The speaker states, "These tools did not exist 10 years ago," while modern tool logos are shown. (6) The speaker says they have "more than 100 volunteers in eight countries now" and that they sell cars. (7) A slide with "KEEP UP THE AWESOME!! RAPIDLY SOLVE PROBLEMS FOR SOCIAL GOOD" and a gorilla and shark graphic is displayed.

Therefore, the correct sequence is option C: 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4 -> 5 -> 7 -> 6.
